definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The Song Mountain was named as the "Oriental Gibraltar" by American military experts.
sentences.chinese: 松山被美國軍事家稱爲“東方直布羅陀”。

sentences.english: Zeng Guofang was an outstanding strategist in China's modern history.
sentences.chinese: 曾國藩是中國近代傑出的軍事家。

sentences.english: Sun Bin word burling, the Warring States period, a famous military strategist.
sentences.chinese: 孫臏字伯靈，戰國時期著名軍事家。

sentences.english: San Martin was an outstanding militarist in the Independence Movement of Latin America.
sentences.chinese: 聖馬丁是拉丁美洲獨立運動中湧現出的著名軍事家。

sentences.english: Big way division militia movement has attracted interest in domestic and foreign military experts.
sentences.chinese: 大辦民兵師運動也吸引了國內外軍事家的興趣。

sentences.english: Lin Boqu, Chinese soldier and revolutionary, died of illness in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 中國軍事家和革命家林柏渠在北京病逝。

sentences.english: Sun Bin Military tactics is the masterpiece of a famous military strategist, Sun Bin, in the Warring Period.
sentences.chinese: 《孫臏兵法》是戰國時期著名軍事家孫臏的代表作。

sentences.english: As a militarist , he must have tactical awareness.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一位軍事家，他必須有戰術意識。

sentences.english: Turner benefited from the great commander's deeds in another way too.
sentences.chinese: 透納還從這位偉大軍事家的行爲中獲得了其他好處。

definition: jurist/member of the pre-Han legalist school
variant of 邱吉爾|邱吉尔[Qiu1 ji2 er3]
scholar of the rationalist school of Neo-Confucianism 理學|理学[Li3 xue2]
Marcus Tullius Cicero (106-43 BC), famous Roman politician, orator and philosopher, murdered at the orders of Marc Anthony
Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), German philosopher
